ai.summary: Bohill Forest offers a short, easy hike in the UK. The 1.3 km trail is suitable for beginners and families, with mostly gentle terrain and shaded woodland surroundings.
ai.terrain_summary: The route follows well-maintained forest paths with gentle gradients. Expect a compact earth surface with occasional exposed roots and puddles after rain. Mostly shaded, with limited long views.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and trail conditions before you go. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and bring a light layer; trails can be muddy. Stay on marked paths, carry a map or offline navigation, and tell someone your plans. Bring water, a small first aid kit, and a phone with emergency contacts. Be mindful of ticks in woodland and seasonal wildlife.
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn; winter can be muddy with shorter daylight.

seo.meta_description: Explore Bohill Forest with a short and easy 1.3 km hike in the UK. Perfect for beginners and families, featuring gentle terrain and shaded paths.
